subject: Photography
title: How Light Creates Shape
description: A short lesson to help you apply How Light Creates Shape.

hook.text: A ball lit from the front looks flat. Lit from the side, it becomes three-dimensional. Light sculpts shape.

buildup.text: Light and shadow together reveal form. Without shadow, objects lose depth and appear as flat cutouts.

discovery.text: Side lighting creates a gradient from light to dark across a surface, revealing curves and texture.

twist.text: Flat front lighting is used for passports and ID photos â€” precisely because it removes character and dimension.

climax.text: Great photographers don't just illuminate subjects. They sculpt them with light, creating depth from flatness.

punchline.text: Light doesn't just show things. It shapes them.

quiz.question: Why does side lighting reveal more three-dimensional form?
options: It creates gradients of light and shadow across surfaces
It is brighter than front lighting
It only works on round objects
